content: #293 retweed designed by kate salomon our retweed cowl is crafted with a straightforward slipped stitch pattern made more sophisticated by alternating three colors this snug fitting unisex cowl will easily fit under a winter jacket and can easily be modified to a different circumference to fit your preference best of all you may be able to make more than one giving you a ready gift for someone in need finished measurements circumference 22 / 56 cm depth 11 /28 cm gauge 17 stitches & 33 row = 4 inches 10cm in tweed pattern materials yarn 3 skeins green mountain green in contrasting colors 140 yds each needles us size 8 5 mm 24 circular needles notions embroidery needle stitch markers glossary pm = place marker sm = slip marker bor = begining of round please note you ll use approximately 70 yards of each of your contrasting colors to make a cowl with the specified measurements this means you ll have sufficient yardage to make two and gift one to someone you love alternatively you can modify the shape of your cowl to your preference if you d prefer a larger circumference no problem simply ensure that your cast on stitch count is an even number instructions using color a cast on 98 sts and join to work in the round placing a bor marker continue working cowl repeating the 12 row tweed pattern alternating colors as described below gently pulling the working yarn under the other two yarns not called for until you reach desired depth ending on an odd row cast off loosely on a knit row finishing weave in loose ends on ws of work the cowl will be softer and more beautiful after hand-washing in warm water with a mild soap or detergent rinse in warm water then roll in a towel to remove excess moisture or spin dry in a washing machin e for 10 seconds only lay flat to dry in a well- ventilated area shaping to correct measurements block if necessary tweed pattern stitch row 1 color b slip with yarn in front k1 * repeat row 7 color b k1 slip with yarn in front * repeat to marker to marker row 2 color c knit all stitches row 8 color c knit all stitches row 3 color a k1 slip with yarn in front * repeat row 9 color a slip with yarn in front k1 * repeat to marker to marker row 4 color b knit all stitches row 10 color b knit all stitches row 5 color c slip with yarn in front k1 * repeat row 11 color c k1 slip with yarn in front * to marker
